qas.question: What was the lifespan of Theodore Hesburgh?
During what years was Theodor Hesburgh president of Notre Dame?
In the time that Hesburgh was president of Notre Dame by what factor did the operating budget increase?
What was the size of the Notre Dame endowment when Theodore Hesburgh became president?
How many faculty members were at Notre Dame when Hesburgh left the role of president?

context: The Rev. Theodore Hesburgh, C.S.C., (<a0_0>1917–2015<a0_0/>) served as president for 35 years (<a1_0>1952–87<a1_0/>) of dramatic transformations. In that time the annual operating budget rose by a factor of <a2_0>18<a2_0/> from $9.7 million to $176.6 million, and the endowment by a factor of 40 from <a3_0>$9 million<a3_0/> to $350 million, and research funding by a factor of 20 from $735,000 to $15 million. Enrollment nearly doubled from 4,979 to 9,600, faculty more than doubled 389 to <a4_0>950<a4_0/>, and degrees awarded annually doubled from 1,212 to 2,500.
